IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Oversight and promotion of bowling activities of approximately 280 to 300 bowling leagues and 9 bowling tournaments for its members.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Southern Nevada affiliate of the United States Bowling Congress serves more than 10,800 members by working to develop and enhance the bowling experience by providing various products (e.g., Tournaments) and services to its members.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Organizational Dues (USBC). Dues for the national, state and local organizations are collected and placed in a bank account that the national organization has access to. They initially take the full amount and then remit our portion. The revenue noted represents the total collected and the expenses are the amount retained by the national organization.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Facilities & Equipment: Includes rent, Copier lease & maintenance (Office has two commercial copiers, one of which is leased), utilities, insurance, office cleaning, etc. There is no income related to Facilities and Equipment.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: This line covers a wide variety of expenses. Most relevant of these are: Office staff salaries and payroll expense - 69,973; Charitable Donations - $30,716.50 (Note: these are collected throughout the year and sent to the charities at the end of the year. They are initially listed as income.); Hall of Fame & Awards Banquet - 10,147; Local awards - 6,904.88; Office supplies - 4,043.38.

OtherExpensesGrp.Desc: Membership Dues Paid to Parent Org.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Schedule A, Part III, Line 12 - Contributions ($25,021.86) received for Susan G. Komen and Bowlers for Veterans are subsequently sent to the charities. Cost ($1,188) of rings and plaques for newly elected Hall of Fame members. Miscellaneous ($1,377): Most of this covers the cost of printing annual average books.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Schedule D, Part VI, Line 1d - Schedule D, Part VI, Line 1d - The organization maintains a permanent office that has the following office equipment: Desks - 5; desktop computers - 4, laptop computers - 2, Desktop Laser Printers - 4, Large commercial printers - 2, file cabinets - 8, misc equipment (chairs, tournament equip, etc.). No depreciation has ever been taken on any of the assets. With the exception of the desks and chairs, all equipment listed is at least 3 years old. Cost noted is a low estimate. When and if the equipment will be discarded, it will be provided at no cost.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board of Directors includes a mother and her daughter.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Organization has approximately 11,800 members. This number is subject to change on a yearly basis since they are required to pay their dues on an annual basis. At the annual meeting, they may attend and those present will vote for officers and directors as well as bylaw changes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: At the annual meeting, all members may attend and those present will vote for officers and directors as well as bylaw changes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: At the annual meeting, they may attend and those present will vote for officers and directors as well as bylaw changes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The tax return is completed by the president who is a retired IRS Revenue Agent. Once the 990 has been completed, it is sent to a member of the Audit Committee who is also a retired IRS Revenue Agent for review. The audit committee is made up of accountants who also may elect to review the return prior to filing. Once approved, it is filed and copies are maintained in the office and are available upon written request.There is no charge for the preparation or the fulfillment of copy requests.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization's Executive Committee are responsible for investigating and subsequent actions should any violations become known. Each board members must annually read and sign documents covering conflict of interest, code of conduct, confidentiality agreement and a commitment to serve. These documents are retained in the organization's office files.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Bylaws and the organization's Policy Manual are posted to the organization's website. Copies of all tax returns are maintained in the organization's office and copies may be obtained upon written request.
$28.50 variance related to changes made in Youth Scholarship funds by organization handling program.

The association has an audit committee that audits it's financial statements on a monthly basis. Use of an independent accountant would prove to be a cost that the organization would be hard pressed to absorb. Al;l of the Audit Committee members have accounting backgrounds.
